summary: The 'Caring for Survivors Act of 2025' amends Title 38 of the United States Code to improve and expand eligibility for dependency and indemnity compensation (DIC) paid to survivors of veterans. Key provisions include increasing the DIC amount for surviving spouses, modifying requirements for DIC for survivors of veterans rated totally disabled at the time of death, and establishing a special rule for certain individuals. The bill aims to provide greater financial support to the families of deceased veterans.
